headline: Zero Otto Nove Makes a Move to Manhattan
summary: Pizza purists have long made pilgrimages to the Bronx's Arthur Avenue. Now Chef Roberto Paciullo is slinging more of his Salerno-style pies in a cavernous, trattoria in the Flatiron.

headline: The Power List: Japan
summary: Take a look at the 10 top business leaders in Japan making headlines during the first six months of 2011 in global and regional media.

headline: Colonial with Medical Roots
summary: This historic home in Dobbs Ferry, N.Y., was built in the early 1900s by one the first woman physicians in the Northeast. The restored property has three covered porches and a terrace with expansive views of the Hudson River.

summary: You should think people would use their weekends out in the Hamptons to slow down, but instead, it's the end of June, and social calendar is packed.

headline: China Outfitters Postpones IPO
summary: China Outfitters postponed a plan to raise up to $299 million in a Hong Kong initial public offering due to market volatility.

headline: FCC Stays Neutral on Wireless Competition
summary: Federal telecom regulators took a neutral position on whether the wireless industry is competitive in a new report, but offered few clues as to how it might rule on AT&T's bid to acquire T-Mobile USA.

headline: China Approves Diageo Baijiu Bid
summary: Liquor giant Diageo said that Chinese regulators have approved its bid to take control of a local Sichuan white-spirit maker, some 16 months after the deal was first announced.

summary: News roundup from Indian newspapers, news wires and Web sites on Tuesday, June 28, 2011. Deals India has not verified the stories from other media organizations and does not vouch for their accuracy.

headline: U.S. Accuses Smithfield Foods Unit of Bias
summary: The Justice Department filed a lawsuit against a Smithfield Foods  unit, alleging that Farmfield Foods imposed unnecessary documentary requirements on non-U.S. citizens when establishing their authorization to work in the U.S.

headline: NRC Commissioner's Bid Blocked
summary: A U.S. senator is blocking the second term for one of the top regulators for America's nuclear plants, a move that could leave the Nuclear Regulatory Commission without a full line-up as it reviews the industry's safety practices.

headline: Notable & Quotable
summary: Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts on free speech and why the court struck down Arizona's "Clean Elections" law.

headline: Loughner's Attorneys Fighting Forced Medications
summary: Attorneys for Jared Loughner, accused shooter of Rep. Gabrielle Giffords and 18 others, have filed an emergency motion to block federal authorities from forcibly medicating their client with anti-psychotic drugs.

headline: After Delay, Sudan Leader Arrives in Beijing
summary: Sudanese President Omar al-Bashir arrived for a visit to influential ally China on Tuesday, after a day's delay that threw a wrench into a trip that had already brought Beijing under fire for offering to host him.

headline: Accenture to Join S&P 500
summary: Consulting firm Accenture will be added to the S&P 500 index, replacing Marshall & Ilsley which is being acquired.

headline: Jefferson County Meeting Postponed
summary: The court-appointed receiver for the Jefferson County, Ala., sewer system postponed a public hearing on his proposal to raise rates by 25%, as the county works to avoid filing what would be the largest municipal bankruptcy in history.

headline: LinkedIn, GM Headline List of Russell 1000 Inductees
summary: Both LinkedIn and GM were added to the large-cap Russell 1000, in the once-a-year reshuffling of which stocks will trade within the Russell 1000 and the small-cap Russell 2000.

headline: North Dakota River Recedes by Inches
summary: Residents in inundated Minot, N.D., awoke to a city with its downtown closed, its drinking water untested and its central valley submerged, but as the flooded Souris River inched down, many shook off the daze and tried to carry on with life.

headline: Soccer's Debutante Ball
summary: The Under-17 World Cup is meant to provide scouts with the first real sense of the players who will pan out and those who will fizzle. But is the youth tournament a reliable predictor of talent?

headline: GM Calls Fuel Regime 'Tough'
summary: A GM executive said the Obama administration's proposed fuel-economy requirement of going 56.2 miles on a gallon of gasoline will be "tough" to meet by 2025 but the auto maker will meet whatever standard is imposed.

headline: U.S. Stocks Rally
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average gained 108.98 points, snapping a three-session losing streak, led by technology and financial stocks.

summary: A new clothing category has emerged for bike-loving city-dwellers, and some new cyclist-oriented fashions can even go from the bike to work or cocktails without a hitch.

headline: Options Market Expects Big Swings From Visa
summary: The options market is betting that key rules on debit-card transaction fees due Wednesday will cause a big move in Visa stock.

summary: Markets Data Center: Biggest Price Decliners.

summary: Akzo Nobel issued a profit warning, cutting its full-year earnings forecast due to challenging trading conditions and further rises in raw-material costs.

headline: Sumitomo Metal to Buy Standard Steel
summary: Sumitomo Metal Industries said it has reached an agreement to buy Pittsburgh-based Standard Steel, a maker of train wheels and axles, for about $340 million.

headline: As Deadline Nears, TMX Battle Heats Up
summary: Both sides vying for TMX Group, operator of Canada's flagship stock exchange, launched 11th-hour scrambles for investor backing Monday, a day before proxies were due for this week's shareholder meeting called to approve a proposed tie-up with London Stock Exchange Group.

summary: Markets Data Center: Money Flow Leaders.

headline: Photos of the Day: June 27

headline: Brent Crude (Up) and Nymex (Down) Part Ways
summary: U.S. oil futures fell slightly in thin trading Monday, as concerns about Greece's debt crisis and U.S. demand kept a lid on prices.

headline: Must-Have Mobile Tech Tools for Entrepreneurs
summary: Find out how you can get work done wherever you go, from storing data and making payroll to tracking auto mileage and accepting credit-card payments.

headline: The Battle of Harrisburg: Bankruptcy or Budget Cuts?
summary: Harrisburg, Pa., residents will have an opportunity to grill elected officials at a public hearing as the state, county and city continue to fight over how to deal with the state capital's debt burden.

headline: Korea's Lee Plans to Keep Pushing
summary: The administration of South Korean President Lee Myung-bak will continue pushing for a broad economic overhaul and privatization of government companies, Finance Minister Bahk Jae-wan said, but may have to be satisfied with small steps.

headline: Delta to Take a Charge for Job Cuts
summary: Delta Air Lines said it will take an unspecified second-quarter charge against planned job cuts, and said it expected operating margins for the quarter that fell short of analysts' expectations, in a further sign of the industry's tougher operating environment.

headline: Growing Debts of China's Local Governments
summary: China's National Audit Office says that local governments are in the hole for $1.7 trillion. But that number diverges from other estimates on the amount of debt China's local governments have taken on.

summary: A meeting in Rome between representatives of private and official lenders to Greece discussed a variety of proposals to deal with the country's debt problems, including the possibility of financing buybacks of Greek government bonds.

headline: Europe Stocks Tread Water
summary: Investors held back from European stocks, wary of making bold moves ahead of key votes in Greece later this week.

headline: High Court to Hear Generic-Drug Case
summary: The Supreme Court agreed on Monday to consider whether generic-drug makers can file certain legal counterclaims against branded-drug companies to get their cheaper, copycat medicines on the market.

headline: New Justice Kagan Shores Up Liberals
summary: Justice Kagan in some cases voting to the left of Justice Sonia Sotomayor, a former prosecutor who was Mr. Obama's first Supreme Court appointment.

headline: Supreme Court Bars Suit Against Goodyear
summary: The Supreme Court ruled that three foreign subsidiaries of Goodyear can't be sued in a North Carolina court over a French bus accident that killed two of the state's residents.

summary: The Des Moines Register is out with its first poll of the cycle, and it brings good tidings for the Minnesota Congresswoman.

headline: Murchison Seeks Chinese Partners for Project
summary: Australia's Murchison Metals opened the door for Chinese investors to join its $5.25 billion iron ore port and rail development after conceding it is finding it difficult to fund its own share of the project.

headline: Sun Art Draws Cornerstone Investors for IPO
summary: Chinese hypermarket operator Sun Art Retail Group has locked in nine cornerstone investors including a sovereign-wealth fund for its planned Hong Kong IPO aimed at raising as much as US$1.06 billion.

summary: See photos from some festivals and events coming up in Germany in the next six months.

headline: Deutsche Bank: Greece Debt Plan Needs 'a Lot of Work'

headline: Mongolian Street Style
summary: From the steppes to the city, Mongolia's stylish inhabitants reflect the cultural shifts taking place within their country.

headline: An Alien in New York
summary: Mehreen Jabbar, a Karachi-born television and film director, melds Pakistan and Manhattan.

headline: Irish Life Admits Defeat
summary: Irish Life & Permanent Plc has admitted defeat in its bid to find €4 billion by a mid-summer deadline, saying the Irish government plans to cancel its stock market listings and take it into full government ownership next month.

headline: China's Haute-Couture High Rollers
summary: Some investors fear rising inflation and property prices will hit China's $21 billion market for luxury goods. But demand is showing little sign of a slowdown.

headline: ISS Backs NYSE-Deutsche Börse Tie-Up
summary: Proxy advisory firm ISS Proxy Services recommended NYSE Euronext shareholders vote in favor of the Big Board owner's planned merger with Deutsche Börse ahead of a key shareholder decision on the deal July 7.

headline: Tokyo Falls as Investors Gird for Greek Vote, Tankan
summary: Japanese shares fell, as exporters such as Toyota Motor and Kyocera were hit by concerns about a weakened euro and Greece's debt problems, while investors feared Friday's closely watched quarterly tankan survey will show a sharp deterioration in business sentiment.

headline: Outflows Seen as Key Risk for Greek Banks
summary: The risk of continued private-sector customer deposit outflows is "a key" credit negative for Greek banks, Moody's Investors Service said.

headline: Goodrich CEO: 'We Hate the Weak Dollar'
summary: U.S. aerospace giant Goodrich is hurt by weakness of the dollar and would like to see the greenback strengthen, said the company's chief executive.

headline: NMDC, Brazil's Greystone in Partnership Talks
summary: NMDC is in talks with Brazil-based mining company Greystone Mineracao do Brasil Limitada for a strategic partnership, its chairman Rana Som said, but didn't give any further details.

headline: ONGC to Approve Share Sale Prospectus Tuesday
summary: Oil & Natural Gas Corp's board will approve the prospectus for the company's upcoming share sale at a meeting Tuesday, the state-run explorer's chairman A.K. Hazarika said.

summary: Gays and lesbians already planning to march in New York City's Gay Pride parade Sunday had extra reason to celebrate after the state's legislature legalized same-sex marriage Friday night.

headline: City Club Hotel Looks To Double Room Count

headline: France Wants Funds to Join Greece Rollover
summary: The French government would like private investment funds to join a private-sector effort to help bail out Greece, because it fears the contribution of banks and insurers alone will fall short of a €30 billion target set by European governments, people familiar with the matter said.

headline: Danish Bank Collapse Causes Jitters
summary: Shares in several small Danish banks fell sharply amid concerns that access to funding markets will get more difficult in the wake of the default of Danish lender Fjordbank Mors.

headline: India's Fuel Tax Cut Threatens Deficit Target
summary: India's move to cut excise and import taxes on crude oil and fuel products will weigh on its fiscal deficit target adding to growing concerns over the ability of Asia's third-largest economy to stick to fiscal goals.

headline: Artistic Loft Along the High Line
summary: Spanning some 3,900 square feet, this Chelsea loft serves as a haven for the owner's rotating collection of art. There's also a green wall inspired by Granny Smith apples.

headline: India Appoints New Foreign Secretary
summary: India appointed its ambassador to France as foreign secretary, a senior bureaucratic post that is heavily involved in trying to get relations with Pakistan back on a firmer footing.

headline: Wen: Hard to Keep Inflation Down
summary: It will be hard to keep China's inflation rate under 4% this year, but it's possible to cap it below 5%, China Premier Wen Jiabao said in a TV interview, marking the government's latest backtracking on inflation.

headline: ECB's Stark Warns on Debt Restructure
summary: A debt restructuring isn't an alternative option for Greece as the consequences of such an event on Europe's financial markets could dwarf the bankruptcy of Lehman Brothers, a key member of the ECB's executive board said.

headline: Finance Minister Urges States to Cut Fuel Taxes
summary: India's finance minister has urged state governments to reduce the local taxes they levy on fuel products to help shield consumers from a spike in oil prices.

headline: India Shares Rally on Falling Oil Prices
summary: Indian shares rallied for a third consecutive session to their highest close in nearly three weeks Monday due to short-covering ahead of the expiry of the June derivative contracts later this week, and supported by a further fall in crude oil prices.

headline: Posco Consortium, CJ Submit Final Bids for Korea Express
summary: A consortium led by Posco and CJ Group separately submitted final bids for a controlling stake in Korea Express, while Lotte Group, the third company that received a notice for the final auction, walked out of the deal.

headline: A Bit of Burlesque

headline: India Inc. Dividend Payouts Rise 12% in FY11 Despite Global Slowdown

headline: Week Ahead: India's Mukherjee, Geithner to Meet
summary: Inflationary pressures aren't likely to ease after last week's diesel and cooking fuel price rise aimed at improving the government's finances, and rising prices may not do much to improve investments into India.

headline: Indonesia Abattoirs Bar Australian Veterinarians
summary: Australian veterinarians seeking to review animal-welfare standards in Indonesia have been denied access to abattoirs there, potentially delaying any resumption of the suspended cattle trade, Australia's Agriculture Minister Joe Ludwig said.

summary: Australian and South Korean banks are the most exposed in Asia to Europe's debt crisis, given their dependence on offshore wholesale funding markets, a senior official at Fitch Ratings said.

headline: Carter Shoulders New Zealand's Hopes
summary: Daniel Carter has the hopes of the Pacific nation at this year's Rugby World Cup set to kick off in Auckland on Sept. 9.

headline: O'Grady: A Get-Well Card for Hugo Chávez
summary: Venezuela would be better off if the ailing dictator lives and is held responsible for his misdeeds.

headline: Some Kid Named Justin
summary: Ralph Gardner Jr.'s daughter suggested that to avoid embarrassment he do some research on Justin Bieber before heading down to Macy's on Thursday.

headline: Ms. Merkel's Reading Tips
summary: Looking to know more about Germany? The Chancellor and other prominent Germans offer some suggestions.

summary: The sale of a large West Village apartment building sparked a lawsuit by a spurned bidder, highlighting the intensifying competition among investors for prime Manhattan residential properties.

summary: CEO Kasper Rorsted says adhesives business and rising Asian prosperity will drive the company's growth.

headline: A Circus Not Worth Flipping Over
summary: Cirque du Soleil is not theater, dance or any sort of performing art that expresses thoughts and emotions. It's a traveling Las Vegas act, writes Pia Catton.

summary: Target lost its first court bid to win the exclusive right to use its name in Canada, where the U.S. retailer plans to expand in the next several years.

summary: Baidu said it will invest $306 million in Chinese travel website Qunar.com Information Technology.

headline: Thai Parties Promise Big Wage Raises Ahead of Election

summary: Cynthia Crossen recommends books for young men (and their parents).

headline: Testing Bureaucrats Fail Own Test

headline: Asia Shares Down Early
summary: Asian stock markets were lower in early Monday trading as investors fretted about euro-zone debt problems, while weakness in exporters' stocks hurt Tokyo and losses in technology shares depressed Seoul.

summary: The acquittal of Mr. Wilders, a member of Dutch Parliament, is welcome news to the entire civilized world. It is fitting that his rights to free speech have been protected in spite of efforts on the part of the Islamists to silence him.

headline: Wal-Mart Aims to Accelerate Growth Overseas
summary: Doug McMillon, head of Wal-Mart's fast-growing international business, discusses the company's troubles in China, moves into India and plans for Europe.

headline: Beaux-Arts Mansion
summary: Once used as a school, this home in Washington, D.C., was fully renovated when it was restored to a single-family residence several years ago. The property includes a 7,000-square-foot main house and a carriage house that has been converted into a guest house.
